meanings.definition: Resistant to fading or changing color when exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent1: The sunfast fabric on the chair stayed vibrant even after years of being in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Her sunfast dress remained bright and colorful even after many washes.
meanings.sent3: The sunfast flowers in the garden seemed to be showing off their long-lasting beauty.
meanings.sent4: His sunfast artwork was a testament to his skill in preserving colors over time.
meanings.sent5: The sunfast paint on the house made it stand out in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A plant that is able to withstand direct sunlight without wilting or fading.
meanings.sent1: The sunfast succulent thrived in the sunny window, soaking up the rays.
meanings.sent2: The sunfast cactus in the desert seemed to enjoy the scorching heat.
meanings.sent3: The sunfast plant proudly displayed its ability to bask in the sunlight all day.
meanings.sent4: The sunfast tree stood tall and strong under the blazing sun, unaffected by its rays.
meanings.sent5: The sunfast flower in the garden was a beacon of resilience in the harsh sunlight.
